Pre-Game Insights: Sunil Chhetri’s impact on Indian football has been extraordinary with an impressive record of over 120 international appearances, scoring more than 90 goals and holding onto the third highest active goalscorer spot behind Cristiano Ronaldo and Lionel Messi.
India’s recent performance showcases a team with many flaws in the defensive department and an attacking department that failed to find the back of the net in recent games.
Kuwait’s performance has been inconsistent recently, securing wins against Bahrain, Syria, and Afghanistan, yet facing bitter defeats, especially in key World Cup qualifier matches.
India’s squad presents a mix of seasoned players and emerging talents. All eyes are on Sunil Chhetri as he captains the team for one final time.
Kuwait’s coach, Rui Bento, enjoys the advantage of a full-strength squad. Notable players include the seasoned striker Yousef Nasser and Faisal Zayed.
Post-Match Reflections: Fans are eager for an unforgettable display from the Indian team, culminating in a deserving homage to their exceptional captain.
Kuwait is set on disrupting the celebrations and clinching a win to bolster their confidence for upcoming games.
Others: The match will be telecast live on the Sports18 Network and will also be streamed live on Jio Cinema.
